name: Mexico City Cathedral! 250 years of construction in one picture.
description:
The Cathedral of Mexico City is located on the north side of the Constitution Plaza "Plaza de la Constitución" in the Historic Center of Mexico City, it is a World Heritage Site since 1987.

The approximate measurements of this temple are 59 meters wide by 128 meters long and a height of 67 meters to the top of the towers. It is one of the most outstanding works of Spanish-American architecture. It was built, according to the plans of the Spanish architect Claudio de Arciniega, who was inspired by Spanish cathedrals, around a church that was erected on the site shortly after the Spanish conquest of Tenochtitlán. Construction began in 1573, was completed on the interior in 1667 and on the exterior until 1813.

It took almost 250 years to build it at is entirety. Because of that extensive construction period, allowed the integration of the diverse architectural styles that were in force and in vogue during those centuries: Gothic, Baroque, Churrigueresque, Neoclassical, among others. The same situation was experienced by the different ornaments, paintings, sculptures and furniture in the interior.
